abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis is taking the fall at Bank of America for the botched acquisition of Merrill Lynch, but, Breakingviews asks, what about the lawyers who advised him?
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis is taking the fall at Bank of America for the botched acquisition of Merrill Lynch, but, Breakingviews asks, what about the lawyers who advised him?
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis is taking the fall at Bank of America for the botched acquisition of Merrill Lynch, Breakingviews says, but what about the lawyers who advised him?

abstract: Bowing to increasing scrutiny of his compensation, Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, agreed not to take a salary or bonus for 2009.
snippet: Bowing to increasing scrutiny of his compensation, Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, agreed not to take a salary or bonus for 2009.
lead_paragraph: Bowing to pressure from Washington’s pay czar, Kenneth D. Lewis agreed on Thursday to forgo his salary and bonus as chief executive of Bank of America, as new legal questions emerged about the troubled takeover of Merrill Lynch that led to his downfall.

headline.main: Bank of America Chief Forgoes Pay for 2009

byline.original: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

abstract: Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, will not receive a salary or bonus for 2009.
snippet: Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, will not receive a salary or bonus for 2009.
lead_paragraph: Bowing to increasing scrutiny of his compensation, Bank of America’s embattled chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, agreed Thursday not to take a salary or bonus for 2009, The New York Times’s Louise Story and Eric Dash report.

headline.main: Vanishing Act: BofA’s Lewis Loses His Paycheck
